content.raw:
Hello!

segtools-aggregation fails with an error where mode is "gene" or "region". I temporarily implemented a workaround in my local version of segtools/aggregation.py:


```
#!python

446     res = empty(bin_starts_unrounded.shape, dtype="float")
447     round(bin_starts_unrounded, out=res)
448     res = res.astype(int)

```

Thanks.

-- Arjan


```
#!python

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/bin/segtools-aggregation", line 9, in <module>
    load_entry_point('segtools===1.1.11.dev-r0', 'console_scripts', 'segtools-aggregation')()
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/aggregation.py", line 962, in main
    validate(bedfilename, featurefilename, outdir, **kwargs)
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/aggregation.py", line 862, in validate
    by_groups=by_groups, verbose=verbose)
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/aggregation.py", line 609, in calc_aggregation
    mode, component_bins)
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/aggregation.py", line 503, in calc_feature_windows
    internal_bins = calc_bin_starts(start, end, num_internal_bins)
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/aggregation.py", line 447, in calc_bin_starts
    round(bin_starts_unrounded, out=res)
  File "/home/av84w/local/python27/lib/python2.7/site-packages/numpy/core/fromnumeric.py", line 2786, in round_
    return round(decimals, out)
TypeError: ufunc 'rint' output (typecode 'd') could not be coerced to provided output parameter (typecode 'l') according to the casting rule ''same_kind''

```
content.html:
Hello!

segtools-aggregation fails with an error where mode is "gene" or "region". I temporarily implemented a workaround in my local version of segtools/aggregation.py:

446     res = empty(bin_starts_unrounded.shape, dtype="float")
447     round(bin_starts_unrounded, out=res)
448     res = res.astype(int)

Thanks.

-- Arjan
